description: The BIS core classes that all other domain schemas extend.

AnnotationElement2d.description: 2D element used to annotate drawings and sheets.
AnnotationElement2d.label: 2D Annotation Element

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

AutoHandledProperty.description: Applied to an element's property to indicate that select, update, and insert of the property's value are handled automatically by the platform.

ClassHasHandler.description: Applied to an ECClass to indicate that a subclass of DgnDomain::Handler will be supplied for it at run-time.

properties.description: List of actions which are not permitted when the associated handler is not available
properties.name: Restrictions

CodeSpec.description: A Code Specification captures the rules for encoding and decoding significant business information into and from a Code (string). This specification is used to generate and validate Codes.
CodeSpec.label: Code Specification

properties.description: The unique name of Code Specification. A best practice is to incorporate the domain name into the Code Specification name to ensure uniqueness.
properties.name: Name

properties.description: JSON string containing scope and fragment specifications to generate and validate code values
properties.name: JsonProperties

CustomHandledProperty.description: Applied to an element's property to indicate that the property's value is handled specially by a C++ class.

DefinitionElement.description: A Definition Element holds configuration-related information that is meant to be referenced/shared.
DefinitionElement.label: Definition Element

properties.description: If true, this definition should not be displayed in the GUI.
properties.label: Is Private
properties.name: IsPrivate

DefinitionModel.description: A container for persisting definition elements.
DefinitionModel.label: Definition Model

DefinitionPartition.description: A Definition Partition element indicates that there is a definition-related modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. A Definition Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Definition Model.
DefinitionPartition.label: Definition Partition

DictionaryModel.description: The singleton container for repository-specific definition elements.
DictionaryModel.label: Dictionary Model

DocumentCarrier.description: A Document Carrier is an Information Carrier that carries a Document. An electronic file is a good example.
DocumentCarrier.label: Document Carrier

DocumentListModel.description: Contains a list of document elements.
DocumentListModel.label: Document List

DocumentPartition.description: A Document Partition element indicates that there is a document-related modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. A Document Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Document List Model.
DocumentPartition.label: Document Partition

DrawingGraphic.description: 2D element used to persist graphics for use in drawings.
DrawingGraphic.label: Drawing Graphic

DrawingModel.description: A container for persisting drawing graphics.
DrawingModel.label: Drawing Model

DriverBundleElement.description: Element used in conjunction with bis:ElementDrivesElement relationships to bundle multiple inputs before driving the output element.
DriverBundleElement.label: Driver Bundle Element

Element.description: Elements are the smallest individually identifiable building blocks for modeling the real world. Each element represents an entity in the real world. Sets of Elements (contained in Models) are used to model other Elements that represent larger scale real world entities. Using this recursive modeling strategy, Elements can represent entities at any scale. Elements can represent physical things or abstract concepts or simply be information records.

properties.description: The Model that contains this element.
properties.name: Model

properties.description: The last modified time of the element. This is maintained by the core framework and should not be set directly by applications.
properties.label: Last Modified
properties.name: LastMod

properties.description: The Code Specification used to generate and validate the code for the element. The combination of Code Specification, Code Scope Element, and the Code value must be unique.
properties.label: Code Specification
properties.name: CodeSpec

properties.description: Code Scope identifies the element that provides the uniqueness scope for the code value. The combination of Code Specification, Code Scope, and the Code value must be unique.
properties.label: Code Scope
properties.name: CodeScope

properties.description: Code is the formal name (business key) for an element. The combination of Code Specification, Code Scope, and the Code value must be unique.
properties.label: Code
properties.name: CodeValue

properties.description: An optional name given by the user (as opposed to the formal name stored in the Code value).
properties.label: User Label
properties.name: UserLabel

properties.description: The parent element that owns this element.
properties.name: Parent

properties.description: The GUID used to federate this element across repositories.
properties.label: Federation GUID
properties.name: FederationGuid

properties.description: A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist JSON values.
properties.label: JSON Properties
properties.name: JsonProperties

ElementAspect.description: An Element Aspect is a class that defines a set of properties that are related to (and owned by) a single element. Semantically, an Element Aspect can be considered part of the Element. Thus, an Element Aspect is deleted if its owning Element is deleted.
ElementAspect.label: Element Aspect

properties.description: Bits that indicate the status of the dependency. Satisfied=0, Failed=1, Deferred=128. Deferred and Failed bits can be OR'd together.
properties.name: Status

properties.description: The priority of this dependency, relative to other EntityDrivesEntity instances. Note that EntityHasChildEntities dependencies always take priority over EntityDrivesEntity dependencies.
properties.name: Priority

ElementMultiAspect.description: An Element Multi-Aspect is an Element Aspect where there can be N instances of the Element Aspect class per Element.
ElementMultiAspect.label: Element Multi-Aspect

properties.description: The owning Element
properties.name: Element

ElementUniqueAspect.description: An Element Unique Aspect is an Element Aspect where there can be only zero or one instance of the Element Aspect class per Element.
ElementUniqueAspect.label: Element Unique Aspect

properties.description: The owning Element
properties.name: Element

EmbeddedFileLink.description: An information element that links to an embedded file.
EmbeddedFileLink.label: Embedded File Link

GeometricElement.description: Geometric Element is an abstract base class used to model real world entities that intrinsically have geometry.
GeometricElement.label: Geometric Element

GeometricElement2d.description: 2D Geometric Element is an abstract base class used to model information entities that intrinsicly have 2D geometry.
GeometricElement2d.label: 2D Geometric Element

properties.description: The Drawing Category used to categorize the 2D Geometric Element
properties.name: Category

properties.description: The placement origin of the Element.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: The placement rotation (in degrees) of the Element.
properties.name: Rotation

properties.description: The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of the Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box Low
properties.name: BBoxLow

properties.description: The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of the Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box High
properties.name: BBoxHigh

properties.description: Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this Element.
properties.label: Geometry Stream
properties.name: GeometryStream

GeometricElement3d.description: 3D Geometric Element is an abstract base class used to model real world entities that intrinsically have 3D geometry.
GeometricElement3d.label: 3D Geometric Element

properties.description: The Spatial Category used to categorize the 3D Geometric Element
properties.name: Category

properties.description: If true, this element will have an entry in the Spatial Index.
properties.label: In Spatial Index
properties.name: InSpatialIndex

properties.description: The placement origin of the Element.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the orientation of the Element.
properties.name: Yaw

properties.description: The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the orientation of the Element.
properties.name: Pitch

properties.description: The Roll angle (in degrees) of the orientation of the Element.
properties.name: Roll

properties.description: The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of the Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box Low
properties.name: BBoxLow

properties.description: The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of the Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box High
properties.name: BBoxHigh

properties.description: Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this Element.
properties.label: Geometry Stream
properties.name: GeometryStream

GeometricModel.description: A container for persisting geometric elements.
GeometricModel.label: Geometric Model

GeometricModel2d.description: A container for persisting 2D geometric elements.
GeometricModel2d.label: 2D Geometric Model

properties.description: The actual coordinates of (0,0) in Model coordinates. An offest applied to all Model coordinates.
properties.label: Global Origin
properties.name: GlobalOrigin

GeometricModel3d.description: A container for persisting 3D geometric elements.
GeometricModel3d.label: 3D Geometric Model

GeometryPart.description: A Definition Element that specifies a collection of geometry that is meant to be reused across Geometric Element instances. Leveraging Geometry Parts can help reduce file size and improve display performance.
GeometryPart.label: Geometry Part

GraphicalElement2d.description: Abstract base class for 2D Geometric Elements that are used to convey information within graphical presentations (like drawings).
GraphicalElement2d.label: 2D Graphical Element

GraphicalModel2d.description: A container for persisting 2D graphical elements.
GraphicalModel2d.label: 2D Graphical Model

GraphicalType2d.description: Defines a set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a 2D Graphical Element.
GraphicalType2d.label: 2D Graphical Type

GroupInformationElement.description: Group Information is an abstract base class for modeling entities whose main purpose is to reference a group of related elements.
GroupInformationElement.label: Group Information

GroupInformationModel.description: A container for persisting group information elements.
GroupInformationModel.label: Group Information Model

GroupInformationPartition.description: A Group Information Partition element indicates that there is a group-information-related modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. A Group Information Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Group Information Model.
GroupInformationPartition.label: Group Information Partition

IParentElement.description: An interface that indicates that this Element is capable of being a parent (owning child Elements). This interface is mutually exclusive with ISubModeledElement.
IParentElement.label: Parent Element

ISubModeledElement.description: An interface which indicates that an Element can be broken down or described by a (sub) Model.  This interface is mutually exclusive with IParentElement.
ISubModeledElement.label: Modellable Element

InformationCarrierElement.description: An Information Carrier carries information, but is not the information itself. For example, the arrangement of ink on paper or the sequence of electronic bits are information carriers.
InformationCarrierElement.label: Information Carrier

InformationContentElement.description: Information Content Element is an abstract base class for modeling pure information entities. Only the core framework should directly subclass from Information Content Element. Domain and application developers should start with the most appropriate subclass of Information Content Element.
InformationContentElement.label: Information Content Element

InformationModel.description: A container for persisting information elements.
InformationModel.label: Information Model

InformationPartitionElement.description: Information Partition is an abstract base class for elements that indicate that there is a new modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. An Information Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Model.
InformationPartitionElement.label: Information Partition

InformationRecordElement.description: Information Record Element is an abstract base class for modeling information records. Information Record Element is the default choice if no other subclass of Information Content Element makes sense.
InformationRecordElement.label: Information Record Element

InformationRecordModel.description: A container for persisting Information Record Elements
InformationRecordModel.label: Information Record Model

InformationRecordPartition.description: A Information Record Partition element indicates that there is an information-record-related modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. An Information Record Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by an Information Record Model.
InformationRecordPartition.label: Information Record Partition

InformationReferenceElement.description: Information Reference is an abstract base class for modeling entities whose main purpose is to reference something else.
InformationReferenceElement.label: Information Reference

LightLocation.description: The spatial location of a light source
LightLocation.label: Light Location

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

LinkElement.description: An information element that specifies a link.
LinkElement.label: Link

LinkModel.description: A container for persisting link elements.
LinkModel.label: Link Model

LinkPartition.description: A Link Partition element indicates that there is a link-related modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. A Link Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Link Model.
LinkPartition.label: Link Partition

Model.description: A Model is a container for persisting a collection of related elements.

properties.description: The Parent Model (which contains the Modeled Element) is above this model in the information hierarchy.
properties.label: Parent Model
properties.name: ParentModel

properties.description: This Model is modeling (describing or breaking down) this element which is at a higher level of the information hierarchy.
properties.label: Modeled Element
properties.name: ModeledElement

properties.description: If IsPrivate is true then this model should not appear in lists shown to the user.
properties.label: Is Private
properties.name: IsPrivate

properties.description: IsTemplate will be true if this Model is used as a template for creating new instances.
properties.label: Is Template
properties.name: IsTemplate

properties.description: A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist JSON values.
properties.label: JSON Properties
properties.name: JsonProperties

OrthographicViewDefinition.description: A spatial view that always show an parallel projection.
OrthographicViewDefinition.label: Orthographic Spatial View

PhysicalElement.description: A Physical Element is spatially located, has mass, and can be 'touched'.
PhysicalElement.label: Physical Element

PhysicalModel.description: A container for persisting physical elements that model physical space.
PhysicalModel.label: Physical Model

PhysicalPartition.description: A Physical Partition element indicates that there is a physical modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. A Physical Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Physical Model.
PhysicalPartition.label: Physical Partition

PhysicalPortion.description: A Physical Portion represents an arbitrary portion of a larger Physical Element that will be broken down in more detail in a separate (sub) Physical Model.
PhysicalPortion.label: Physical Portion

PhysicalType.description: Defines a set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a Physical Element. A Physical Type has a strong correlation with something that can be ordered from a catalog since all instances share a common set of properties.
PhysicalType.label: Physical Type

RecipeDefinitionElement.description: Defines a recipe for generating a type.
RecipeDefinitionElement.label: Recipe Definition

RepositoryLink.description: An information element that links to a repository.
RepositoryLink.label: Repository Link

RepositoryModel.description: The singleton container of repository-related information elements.
RepositoryModel.label: Repository Model

RoleElement.description: A real world entity is modeled as a Role Element when a set of external circumstances define an important role (one that is worth tracking) that is not intrinsic to the entity playing the role. For example, a person can play the role of a teacher or a rock can play the role of a boundary marker.
RoleElement.label: Role Element

RoleModel.description: A container for persisting role elements.
RoleModel.label: Role Model

SectionDrawingModel.description: A container for persisting section drawing graphics.
SectionDrawingModel.label: Section Drawing Model

SheetModel.description: A container for persisting sheet views and graphics.
SheetModel.label: Sheet Model

SpatialElement.description: A Spatial Element occupies real world space.
SpatialElement.label: Spatial Element

SpatialIndex.description: The Spatial Index contains information used to optimize spatial queries. Like other database indices, it is automatically maintained by the system.
SpatialIndex.label: Spatial Index

properties.description: Minimum X value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Min X
properties.name: MinX

properties.description: Maximum X value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Max X
properties.name: MaxX

properties.description: Minimum Y value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Min Y
properties.name: MinY

properties.description: Maximum Y value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Max Y
properties.name: MaxY

properties.description: Minimum Z value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Min Z
properties.name: MinZ

properties.description: Maximum Z value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Max Z
properties.name: MaxZ

SpatialLocationElement.description: A Spatial Location Element identifies a 'tracked' real world location but has no mass and cannot be 'touched'.
SpatialLocationElement.label: Spatial Location Element

SpatialLocationModel.description: A container for persisting spatial location elements.
SpatialLocationModel.label: Spatial Location Model

SpatialLocationPartition.description: A Spatial Location Partition element indicates that there is a spatial-location-related modeling perspective within the overall DgnDb information hierarchy. A Spatial Location Partition is always parented to a Subject and broken down by a Spatial Location Model.
SpatialLocationPartition.label: Spatial Location Partition

SpatialLocationPortion.description: A Spatial Location Portion represents an arbitrary portion of a larger Spatial Location Element that will be broken down in more detail in a separate (sub) Spatial Location Model.
SpatialLocationPortion.label: Spatial Location Portion

SpatialLocationType.description: Defines a set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a Spatial Location.
SpatialLocationType.label: Spatial Location Type

SpatialModel.description: A container for persisting 3D geometric elements that are spatially located.
SpatialModel.label: Spatial Model

SpatialViewDefinition.description: A view of a spatially located volume.
SpatialViewDefinition.label: Spatial View Definition

Subject.description: A Subject is an information element that describes what this repository (or part thereof) is about.

TemplateRecipe2d.description: A recipe that uses a 2D template for creating new instances.
TemplateRecipe2d.label: 2D Template Recipe

TemplateRecipe3d.description: A recipe that uses a 3D template for creating new instances.
TemplateRecipe3d.label: 3D Template Recipe

TemplateViewDefinition2d.description: A View Definition used to display a 2D template model.
TemplateViewDefinition2d.label: 2D Template View Definition

TemplateViewDefinition3d.description: A View Definition used to display a 3D template model.
TemplateViewDefinition3d.label: 3D Template View Definition

TextAnnotationData.description: The aspect used to store text annotation data for 2D and 3D text annotation elements.
TextAnnotationData.label: Text Annotation Data

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Encoded texture data
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Format of the encoded texture data
properties.name: Format

TypeDefinitionElement.description: Defines a set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with an element.
TypeDefinitionElement.label: Type Definition

UrlLink.description: An information element that specifies a URL link.
UrlLink.label: URL Link

properties.description: The view that is to be attached
properties.name: View

ViewDefinition2d.description: A view of a 2D model that has its own local coordinate system.
ViewDefinition2d.label: 2D View Definition

properties.description: Lower left corner of the viewed area.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: Size of the view diagonal
properties.name: Extents

properties.description: Rotation angle in degrees of the viewed area.
properties.label: Rotation Angle
properties.name: RotationAngle

properties.description: Origin of the viewed volume on the lower, back, rear
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: Size of the view diagonal
properties.name: Extents

properties.description: Yaw component of the view direction in degrees
properties.name: Yaw

properties.description: Pitch component of the view direction in degrees
properties.name: Pitch

properties.description: Roll component of the view direction in degrees
properties.name: Roll

properties.description: Is the camera actually turned on?
properties.label: Is Camera On
properties.name: IsCameraOn

properties.description: Camera eye point
properties.label: Eye Point
properties.name: EyePoint

properties.description: Camera lens angle in degrees
properties.label: Lens Angle
properties.name: LensAngle

properties.description: Camera focus distance
properties.label: Focus Distance
properties.name: FocusDistance

VolumeElement.description: A Volume Element is a Spatial Location Element that is restricted to defining a volume.
VolumeElement.label: Volume Element

label: BIS Core
name: BisCore
